name.en: Department of Translation and Interpretation Studies

structural_unit_name.en: Department of Translation and Interpretation Studies

description.en: Introductory course in the historical development and modern research insights in Translation Studies.
description.et: Sissejuhataval kursusel käsitletakse tõlketeaduse ajaloolist arengut ja uusimaid uurimissuundi.

objectives.en:
It is the aim of this introductory course to make the students acquainted with the origins, historical development and modern research insights of the scholarly discipline Translation Studies. The historical perspective will focus on two general phenomena linked to most of the contemporary research: the broadening of 'translation' as an object of research, and the institutionalization of the discipline. The different schools and turns of the discipline will illustrate the development over the past 50-60 years, and show how Translation Studies relates to adjacent disciplines.
The seminars will mainly be taught by Luc van Doorslaer (LvD), occasionally also a guest lecturer can be invited -- see seminar schedule.
objectives.et: Sissejuhatava kursuse eesmärk on tutvustada üliõpilastele tõlketeaduse kujunemist, ajaloolist arengut ja uusimaid uurimissuundi. Ajaloolisest vaatenurgast keskendutakse kahele põhinähtusele, mis on otseselt seotud tänapäevase käsitlusega: tõlke mõiste kui uurimisobjekti laienemine ja distsipliini institutsionaliseerumine. Erinevate koolkondade ja paradigmamuutuste näitel vaadeldakse viimase 50-60 aasta arenguid tõlketeaduses ja selle suhteid naaberdistsipliinidega.

learning_outcomes.en:
Knowledge of:
- the main research tendencies in Translation Studies over the past 60 years
- the main turns and paradigm changes
- the main research methods
- the relationship of Translation Studies to adjacent disciplines

The ability to:
- critically reflect on the development and institutionalization of the discipline
- critically reflect on the definitions and views on 'translation'

notes.en: For updated information on the seminar planning: please always consult the updates on the course in Moodle.
notes.et: For updated information on the seminar planning: please always consult the updates on the course in Moodle.

description.en:
Differentiated assessment A-B-C-D-E-F-not present
A: excellent, very exceptional
B: very good, exceptional
C: good
D: satisfactory
E: poor, minimally acceptable
F: fail, below the minimum required level
Criteria:
- thoroughness of knowledge of the seminars' content
- level of added critical reflection
- connection of knowledge to other parts of the course
